prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** The first part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with no rotation (euler\\_angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.009]. 2. **Draw the first 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system**. The sketch contains five loops: - **Loop 1** is a rectangle with four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.57, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.57, 0.0], End Point [0.57, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.57, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] - **Loop 2** is a circle centered at [0.06, 0.015] with a radius of 0.0052. - **Loop 3** is a circle centered at [0.06, 0.735] with a radius of 0.0052. - **Loop 4** is a circle centered at [0.51, 0.015] with a radius of 0.0052. - **Loop 5** is a circle centered at [0.51, 0.735] with a radius of 0.0052. These loops form the base for the rectangular prism. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch** uniformly by a factor of 0.75. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** using the coordinate system defined earlier. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch** along the normal vector by 0.009 units to create the 3D model for this part. This will result in a rectangular prism with a height of 0.009 units.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 4 units long, 3 units wide, and 2 units tall. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. The sketch should have one face (face_1) with a loop (loop_1) and three lines. - Line 1: Starting point at [0.0, 0.0], ending point at [0.2812, 0.0] - Line 2: Starting point at [0.2812, 0.0], ending point at [0.2812, 0.082] - Line 3: Starting point at [0.2812, 0.082], ending point at [0.0174, 0.082] - Line 4: Starting point at [0.0174, 0.082], ending point at [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2812. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given Euler angles and translation vector. 6. Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.1875 units - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.1875 units - Sketch scale: 0.2812 Part 2: Construction of a Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Construct a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The prism is slightly tilted to the right. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0409, 0.0909, 0.082] 2. Draw three 2D sketches, one on each of the coordinate plane as described: - Sketch on X-Y plane (face_1): * Loop_1 with 2 lines and 1 arc: + Line 1: Starting point at [0.0469, 0.2372], ending point at [0.1701, 0.2372] + Arc 1: Starting point at [0.1701, 0.2372], midpoint at [0.2169, 0.2841], ending point at [0.1701, 0.331] + Line 2: Starting point at [0.1701, 0.331], ending point at [0.0469, 0.331] + Arc 2: Starting point at [0.0469, 0.331], midpoint at [0.0937, 0.2841], ending point at [0.0469, 0.2372] - Sketch on X-Z plane (face_2): * Loop_1 with 2 lines and 1 arc: + Line 1: Starting point at [0.0469, 0.0], ending point at [0.1701, 0.0] + Arc 1: Starting point at [0.1701, 0.0], midpoint at [0.2169, 0.0469], ending point at [0.1701, 0.0937] + Line 2: Starting point at [0.1701, 0.0937], ending point at [0.0469, 0.0937] + Arc 2: Starting point at [0.0469, 0.0937], midpoint at [0.0937, 0.0</description>
